1.title: Cheers to Beers
1.plot: Quench your curiosity and learn how thirsty miners started a Liquid Gold Rush that began Colorado's journey to become the Beer State.

1.title: Lincoln Hills
1.plot: During the time of racial segregation, Lincoln Hills, the only all African-American resort west of the Mississippi River, provided a shelter from the storm.

2.title: Justina Ford, M.D.
2.plot: Born with two strikes against her, Dr. Justina Ford overcame barriers of race and gender to become the first African-American woman to practice medicine in Colorado and delivered over 7,000 babies.

3.title: Keota
3.plot: The boom and bust of a homesteading community on Colorado's eastern plains.

4.title: Amache
4.plot: While American troops were fighting abroad in World War II, over 7500 Japanese-Americans found themselves interned in the Granada War Relocation Center.

5.title: Spencer & Julie Penrose
5.plot: From exotic animals to opposing prohibition, nothing was too extraordinary for the entrepreneur dubbed a master "promoter" and his sophisticated wife. Delve into the affluent life of Colorado Springs' pioneering couple.

6.title: Pueblo Border Wars
6.plot: Colorado's once industrial capital has long been the battleground for competing countries and interests.

7.title: Ludlow Massacre
7.plot: Examine the bloody history of Colorado coal miners' struggle for workers' rights.

8.title: The Boettchers
8.plot: Discover the rags-to-riches story of one of Colorado's most pioneering families, both in business and philanthropy.

9.title: Colorado Constitution
9.plot: Colorado's top lawyers and historians unravel the unintended consequences of the state's constitution.

10.title: Fly Girl
10.plot: Flying an AT-6 trainer plane in World War II was only the beginning of Grand Junction resident Annabelle Craft Moss's inspirational life.

11.title: Colorado Philanthropy
11.plot: From the beginning of its settlement, Colorado has demonstrated a legacy of giving and philanthropy.

12.title: Bent's Fort
12.plot: During the height of the Fur Trade, Bent's Fort was a great western hub of commercial and cultural exchange.

13.title: The Original Coloradans
13.plot: Discover The Ute Nation, the original residents of Colorado and their lasting impact on the state.

1.title: University of Denver
1.plot: The first 150 years of the University of Denver are explored in this Colorado Experience.

2.title: U.S. Air Force Academy
2.plot: Uncover the secrets of the United States Air Force Academy with a look at the significant events, landmarks and accomplishments throughout its first 60 years.

3.title: The Manassa Mauler
3.plot: Explore the humble beginnings of the Colorado native who came out of the mining towns of the Rocky Mountains to become the World Heavyweight Boxing Champion: the Manassa Mauler, Jack Dempsey.

4.title: The Dust Bowl
4.plot: Revisit the dust filled skies of Southeast Colorado during one of the biggest environmental catastrophes in history.

5.title: Colorado's Cold War
5.plot: The Rocky Flats Nuclear Weapons Plant manufactured the plutonium trigger used in every nuclear weapon produced in the United States. Discover the local impact of a global conflict.

6.title: Pope John Paul II
6.plot: Take part in the largest gathering in Colorado history. Pope John Paul II's visit to Colorado in 1993 drew participants from all over the country - and the world.

7.title: Living West: Water
7.plot: What happened to the Ancestral Puebloans of Mesa Verde and Goodman Point? Dive into this Southwest Colorado mystery.

8.title: NORAD
8.plot: Enter through the North Portal of Cheyenne Mountain for a rare look at the top secret North American Aerospace Defense Command.

9.title: The Smaldones: Family of Crime
9.plot: Discover the legacy of Clyde Smaldone, the head of Denver's most notorious organized crime syndicate.

10.title: Sand Creek Massacre
10.plot: November 29, 1864 marks a dark time in Colorado's history. Commemorate the tragic attack on a peaceful Cheyenne and Arapaho settlement.

11.title: Justicia y Libertad
11.plot: Explore the roots, the art, the injustice and the empowerment of Colorado's Chicano Movement.

12.title: Jewish Pioneers
12.plot: Relive the War of the Currents. Discover the eccentric personalities racing to spark history in Telluride.

13.title: Hydro Power
13.plot: Relive the War of the Currents and discover the eccentric personalities racing to spark history in Telluride.

1.title: Boggsville
1.plot: Explore the booming 1866 town on the Eastern Plains and the colorful characters who lived there until tragedy struck in the 1880s.

2.title: Indulgences of the West
2.plot: From opium Joss Houses and Lydia E. Pinkham's Tonic to the 1937 Marijuana Tax Act, discover the early addictions of the west.

3.title: The Sheriff
3.plot: As El Paso County's first sheriff, Rankin Scott Kelly helped pursue the Espinosa Brothers and found himself in numerous shootouts with notorious outlaws.

4.title: National Western Stock Show
4.plot: From rodeos and parades to auctions and cowboy art, discover the globally known event that has occurred annually since 1906.

5.title: Last Stop 'til Denver
5.plot: From Mary Cawker to Millie Booth, meet the pioneering women whose hard work and vision brought the oldest house in Denver to life.

6.title: Speer & the City
6.plot: Meet the controversial Mayor who's City Beautiful vision built Denver's Civic Center Park and parkway system in the last 1890s.

7.title: The San Luis Valley
7.plot: Examine the lasting impact of the cultural, artistic, and architectural contributions of Colorado's First Town.

8.title: Cinema on the Plains
8.plot: Discover the glamorous Hollywood-style movie theaters that served as social hubs from 1910 to the 1950s.

9.title: Gateway to the High Country
9.plot: Marvel at the engineering achievement of Colorado's most famous and frequently used tunnel, the Eisenhower-Johnson Memorial Tunnel, and discover the tragedies it has seen since it opened in 1973.

10.title: Colorado Coined
10.plot: Step inside the historic 1906 building, investigate the wild robbery of 1922, and discover the secrets behind the Denver Mint.

11.title: Ladies of the Mines
11.plot: Discover the hardships, innovations and tenacity of the women caught up in Colorado's mining bug.

12.title: Pleasant Hill Bus Tragedy
12.plot: Delve into 1931 when a winter blizzard took the lives of five children who were stranded in a school bus.

13.title: Miss Opportunity: The Life & Times of Emily Griffith
13.plot: Meet the women whose lasting legacy on education lives today, even as her murder remains an unsolved mystery.

14.title: Garden of the Gods
14.plot: A look at the history and beauty of the Garden of the Gods, a treasured park and tourist attraction near Colorado Springs that boasts stunning red rocks and breathtaking views.

1.title: Big Thompson Flood
1.plot: When the skies opened on July 31, 1979, few anticipated this summer storm would result in the deadliest flash flood in Colorado's recorded history.

2.title: Hotel de Paris
2.plot: Amid Colorado's booming Silver Rush, Louis Depuy, a mysterious Frenchman, opened a first-class French restaurant and hotel in the mining town of Georgetown.

3.title: LGBT
3.plot: During Colorado's Gold Rush days, newspaper headlines revealed passionate letters and secret elopements between same-sex couples. Nearly two centuries later, the struggle for equality continues within the state's landscape.

4.title: The Stanley Hotel
4.plot: Widely known for inspiring Steven King's 1977 novel, "The Shining," The Stanley Hotel's legacy goes beyond a history of paranormal activity.

5.title: Suffrage
5.plot: On November 7, 1893, Colorado became the first state in the nation to grant women's suffrage by popular vote, a result of nearly 15 years of struggle and dedication.

6.title: Dana Crawford
6.plot: In the early 1960s preservationist Dana Crawford launched her own plan to preserve Denver's historic buildings dating back to the 1860s. Over 50 years later her legacy can be seen throughout the city.

7.title: The Tabors
7.plot: During the Colorado Silver Boom, Horace Tabor, known as "The Bonanza King of Leadville," landed in the Centennial state becoming one of the richest silver barons in history.

8.title: Centennial Farms
8.plot: With a rich history of homesteading, farming and ranching, Colorado boasts nearly 500 hundred Centennial Farms, which remain in operation and are run by descendants of the original families.

9.title: Trinidad
9.plot: Take a walk on the "Trinidad" imprinted brick-paved city streets and discover the beauty of this Southern Colorado town that is once again reinventing itself.

10.title: Courthouses
10.plot: The courthouses across Colorado are much more than judicial landmarks, their placement represents power and land status.

11.title: Perry-Mansfield Performing Arts School & Camp
11.plot: Housed today in Steamboat Springs, Perry-Mansfield Performing Arts School and Camp boasts alumni from Jose Limon, a pioneer of modern dance, to actors including Julie Harris and Dustin Hoffman.

12.title: Dinosaurs
12.plot: Discover the "Bone Wars" of the late 1800s, major fossil finds across the state, and take a walk in 150 million year old dinosaur tracks.

13.title: KKK
13.plot: From the Grand Dragon to known KKK appointees in the police, mayor's and governor's offices, Colorado once had the 2nd largest Klu Klux Klan Membership in the United States. Discover the sordid history of the KKK in Colorado and the impact they had on Catholics, Jews and African Americans in early 1920s, and the courageous individuals who fought against their establishment.

9.title: Settling the Sand Dunes
9.plot:

 Be the first one to add a plot.

10.title: Mountain Biking
10.plot: Explore the exciting world of mountain biking that has been dazzling thrill-seekers since 1891 and is now a major force of recreation and tourism.

11.title: Denver Mountain Parks
11.plot: Take a trip to the parks that make up the unique Denver Mountain Park system and meet the pioneers who preserved these parks for tourists and Coloradans alike.

12.title: Mountain Escapes
12.plot: Venture to Grand Lake and Steamboat Springs to visit the mountain escapes that have housed travelers since they first arrived over one hundred years ago.

13.title: White Gold
13.plot: Delve into the rich legacy of Sugar Beets in Colorado and explore the many ways this agricultural centerpiece enriched the state.

14.title: The Gang of 19: ADA Movement
14.plot: Meet the brave Coloradans that challenged the status quo to advocate for the passing of the Americans with Disabilities Act.

locations: Rocky Mountain PBS, Denver, Colorado, USA
History Colorado Center, Denver, Colorado, USA
imdb.plot outline: A television series dedicated to preserving and celebrating the people, places, and events that have shaped Colorado. We bring to life these fascinating yet sometimes little known chapters in the state's evolution. From dinosaurs to the craft brewing revolution, the series explores how history has contributed to today's Coloradan identity.
imdb.title: Colorado Experience
plot: A television series dedicated to preserving and celebrating the people, places, and events that have shaped Colorado. We bring to life these fascinating yet sometimes little known chapters in the state's evolution. From dinosaurs to the craft brewing revolution, the series explores how history has contributed to today's Coloradan identity.::Rocky Mountain PBS
